title: 2 Corinthians Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Corinthians with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 13 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of 2 Corinthians as introduced in chapter 1?
questions.explanation: The letter opens with Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, addressing the church.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 1:3, God is called the Father of what?
questions.explanation: Paul describes God as the Father of mercies and the God of all comfort.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 1:4, what is the purpose of the comfort God gives us?
options: To comfort others in any trouble
questions.correctAnswer: To comfort others in any trouble
questions.explanation: God comforts us in all our tribulations so we can comfort those in trouble.

questions.question: What did Paul say about the sufferings of Christ in us, in 2 Corinthians 1:5?
options: As they abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ
questions.correctAnswer: As they abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that the sufferings of Christ in believers bring about abundant consolation through Christ.

questions.question: In chapter 1, what did Paul say was the reason they do not trust in themselves, but in God who raises the dead?
options: Because they had the sentence of death in themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had the sentence of death in themselves
questions.explanation: Paul explains that they were pressed beyond strength and had the sentence of death in themselves to trust only in God.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 1:20, Paul states that all the promises of God are yea and in Him Amen.
questions.explanation: Paul affirms that in Christ all promises of God are confirmed with 'yea' and 'Amen'.

questions.question: Who were the three men that preached Jesus Christ among the Corinthians, according to 2 Corinthians 1:19?
questions.explanation: Paul mentions himself, Silvanus, and Timotheus as those who preached Jesus Christ among the Corinthians.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight of ______.'
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that our temporary afflictions produce an eternal weight of glory.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:7, what do we have in earthen vessels?
questions.explanation: Paul explains that the treasure is the excellency of the power of God, not of ourselves.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 4:4, who is described as the god of this world who blinds the minds of unbelievers?
questions.explanation: The 'god of this world' refers to Satan who blinds the minds of those who do not believe.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 4:16, though our outward man perishes, the inward man is renewed day by day.
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts physical deterioration with spiritual renewal.

questions.question: What does Paul say about the gospel in 2 Corinthians 4:5?
options: We preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord
We preach ourselves to gain fame
We preach a different gospel to each group
We preach only to the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: We preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that the gospel ministry is centered on Christ, not self-promotion.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 7:1, believers are urged to cleanse themselves from what?
options: All filthiness of the flesh and spirit
questions.correctAnswer: All filthiness of the flesh and spirit
questions.explanation: Paul calls for holiness by cleansing from all moral and spiritual uncleanness.

questions.question: What was the effect of Paul's previous letter to the Corinthians, according to 2 Corinthians 7:8-9?
options: It made them sorry to repentance
It was received with joy only
questions.correctAnswer: It made them sorry to repentance
questions.explanation: Paul rejoices because the sorrow caused by the letter led to godly repentance.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says in 2 Corinthians 7:10 that the sorrow of the world works death.
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts godly sorrow that leads to salvation with worldly sorrow that leads to death.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 7:6, who comforted Paul and his companions in Macedonia?
options: God by the coming of Titus
questions.correctAnswer: God by the coming of Titus
questions.explanation: God comforted them through Titus’ arrival bringing good news.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 10:4, what kind of weapons does Paul say we use in spiritual warfare?
options: Mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds
questions.explanation: Paul teaches the spiritual nature and divine power of Christian weapons.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 10:3, Paul says we war according to the flesh.
questions.explanation: Paul states that though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:17, in whom should one glory?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs that glory is due only to the Lord.

questions.question: What does Paul urge the Corinthians to do in 2 Corinthians 13:5?
options: Examine themselves whether they are in the faith
questions.correctAnswer: Examine themselves whether they are in the faith
questions.explanation: Paul calls for self-examination to confirm genuine faith.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 13:4, Paul says that Christ was crucified through weakness but now lives by the power of God.
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts Christ's crucifixion and resurrection emphasizing divine power.

questions.question: How many times did Paul say he was coming to the Corinthians in 2 Corinthians 13:1?
questions.explanation: Paul states this is the third time he is coming to them.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be of one mind, live in ______.'
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts the believers to live in peace.

questions.question: Who in 2 Corinthians 1:19 is described as 'not yea and nay, but in him was yea'?
questions.explanation: Jesus Christ is the Son of God whose promises are yes and amen.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 1:24, Paul claims dominion over the Corinthians' faith.
questions.explanation: Paul states he does not have dominion over their faith but is a helper of their joy.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 4:16, what happens to the inward man day by day?
questions.explanation: Though the outward man perishes, the inward man is renewed daily.

questions.question: What does Paul say is hidden to those who are lost in 2 Corinthians 4:3?
questions.explanation: Paul says if the gospel is hidden, it is hidden to those who are lost.

questions.question: What kind of sorrow does Paul say works repentance to salvation in 2 Corinthians 7:10?
questions.explanation: Godly sorrow leads to repentance and salvation, unlike worldly sorrow.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 7:15, Paul speaks of the Corinthians' obedience as received with fear and trembling.
questions.explanation: Paul affirms their obedience was received with reverence and awe.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 10:10, how do some describe Paul's letters?
questions.explanation: Some say Paul's letters are weighty and powerful, but his bodily presence is weak.

questions.question: Paul says in 2 Corinthians 13:9 that he is glad when he is weak and the Corinthians are what?
questions.explanation: Paul desires their perfection and rejoices when they are strong.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 1:8 tells us Paul and his companions despaired even of life when pressed beyond strength in Asia.
questions.explanation: Paul describes their extreme tribulation and despair of life in Asia.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For we which live are alway delivered unto death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus might be made manifest in our ______ flesh.'
questions.explanation: Paul speaks of manifesting the life of Jesus in our mortal flesh.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 7:7, what did Titus tell Paul that refreshed his spirit?
options: The earnest desire, mourning, and fervent mind of the Corinthians
questions.correctAnswer: The earnest desire, mourning, and fervent mind of the Corinthians
questions.explanation: Titus shared the Corinthians' sincere repentance and zeal.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 13:14, what three persons are mentioned in the apostolic benediction?
options: The Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost
God the Father, the Son, and the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: This is the closing blessing of the epistle.

questions.question: True or False: Paul calls God as a record upon his soul that he came to Corinth to spare them, in 2 Corinthians 1:23.
questions.explanation: Paul testifies that he delayed his coming to spare the Corinthians.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 1:22 say God gave us in our hearts as a seal and earnest?
questions.explanation: God sealed believers and gave the earnest of the Spirit in their hearts.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 10:9, Paul wants to terrify the Corinthians by his letters.
questions.explanation: Paul states he does not want to appear to terrify by letters.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 7:4, how does Paul describe his feelings toward the Corinthians despite tribulation?
options: Filled with comfort and exceeding joyful
questions.correctAnswer: Filled with comfort and exceeding joyful
questions.explanation: Paul expresses great comfort and joy amid tribulation because of the Corinthians.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by letters when we are absent, such will we be also in ______ when we are present.'
questions.explanation: Paul promises consistency between his written word and his actions.

questions.question: What is the reason Paul gives in 2 Corinthians 1:12 for his confidence and godly sincerity in his conduct?
options: Because he walked not in fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God
questions.correctAnswer: Because he walked not in fleshly wisdom but by the grace of God
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts godly sincerity with fleshly wisdom in his behavior.

questions.question: True or False: In 2 Corinthians 6:7, Paul lists 'in the word of truth, in the power of God, by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left.'
questions.explanation: Though not quoted above, this is a key teaching found in chapter 6 about spiritual warfare.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 13:10, why does Paul write these things while absent?
options: Lest when present he should use sharpness
To announce a visit to Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: Lest when present he should use sharpness
questions.explanation: Paul writes to edify and not to destroy, using sharpness only if necessary in person.

questions.question: Which chapter contains Paul's teaching about 'the weapons of our warfare'?
questions.explanation: Chapter 10 discusses spiritual warfare and the nature of Christian weapons.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Corinthians 1:20: 'For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him ______, unto the glory of God by us.'
questions.explanation: Paul states that all promises of God in Christ are confirmed with 'yea' and 'Amen'.
